title: I do not want to leave this game, but it is so unfun right now
body:
1. There is no such thing as lategame. 
2. There is no such thing as comeback.  
3. Certain champions are destroying the game. If you don't play them, you lose.
4. The snowball is insane.
5. No such thing as teamwork, since any one player who is ahead can almost single handedly carry.


Ever since I started LoL in season 3, I have never fallen more than 3 levels behind the enemy.
Now I find myself making mistakes that snowball out of control almost every single game. I'm level 13 while Tryn, Yas or Jax is 18..

I am not Diamond, I don't play the game perfectly. I make mistakes. But must I be punished so hard?

Just be patient. It's preseason, of course the shit is hitting the fan. Compared to previous preseasons though, everybody feels it, rather than just a particular group of players (example, Preseason 5 Junglers).

Even compare to others，this is the worst preseason I've ever had.
I have never felt such unbalancement

That's because they hit AD itemization this patch, and really, there's no better time to do that, then during the highly tentative preaseason.
A lot of the other preseasons focused a lot more on improving the quality of life for other classes like support and jungle, roles that themselves are highly contained. If a jungle item gets out of control, we reign it in and make it something only junglers really care about, if a support item is too strong we increase the active cooldown or cut down on the stats.

In this case however, AD items were tackled, something that's needed to happen for awhile honestly due to how pitiful their items were comparative to the variety of choice that AP had. Problem is, that more than just marksmen are affected by these changes, and the AD itemization pool finds itself largely affecting AD assassins, bruisers,  fighters, and to a far lesser extent Juggernauts. Anyone who uses autoattacks as a vital portion of their damage rotation has the ability to opt into these new items, and the flare given to them in order to make meaningful itemization decisions only improves upon that idea of seeing what sticks with all these new toys to play with.

Combine that with the attempt to make masteries more impactful and you have a recipe for chaos. The balance issues are more robust this season because the number of affected champions is far higher, and the changes to make masteries impactful requires that they be strong enough to have an impact, something that's proving to be a bit of an issue, but one they're trying to address.

It'll take a while for the game to get back to a neutral state, there's a lot that needs to be cleaned up, but preseason is the only real time  you can drop dramatic changes like this while still being able to do damage control (Since we're inbetween ranked seasons). Basically, be patient. Its going to take time for the game to come back to where Riot wants it to be this season, and most of these dramatic inbalances will likely be handled in a patch or two. (Patches are on 2 week cycles).

The other nice thing about these changes is that its a chance to highlight certain problem champions who've largely been neglected for quite a time. Champions like Jax and Irelia tend to have massive powerspikes when items are changed, and there are a number of champions whose balance is far too item-dependent. Bringing these guys into center-stage gives riot a chance to think about how their power fluctuates, and potentially take steps to bring them into a more centered state, so that they aren't perceived as bad when off-meta, and aren't ungodly abominations when the items align. Balance is a tricky bastard, its incredibly elusive, and the only thing you can really hope for with a roster as big as league has, is to bring the game to center-state. That takes time, for both the developers and the players learning how to fight around the new changes, and figure out what truely is or isn't in a proper state of disrepair.

Logged in to upvote this. I have been playing this game since closed beta, and I can honestly say for the first time that I do not really even have fun playing the game 80% of the time right now, I only play out of habit. Nothing about any of the preseason changes make me feel like the following year will even improve anything since riot never goes back on big changes no matter how much they obviously should.

The new masteries promote snowballing far more than the old masteries do, as most of them have quite large scaling (which I'm sure riot did to make masteries feel more relevant throughout the game). I don't know what riot expected as these keystones have painfully obvious abuse cases, and give massive power to champs that are already ahead, see crit keystone and deathfire touch. You cannot win a fight in bot lane if you are behind a little gold even with a fantastic engage, because the champ gets a nice 1300 gold efficiency bonus to his investment. The masteries also scale with level greater than before, again encouraging people who are ahead to stay far ahead.

Also, Riot, you said it yourself, preseason is time to make big changes, MAKE SOME BIG CHANGES! Don't keep messing around with these slaps on the wrist, you only have a month left, buff some items, gut some champions, test some things, idc, but do something! What you did isn't working and most don't like where things are at, so do something about it. I didn't even realize 5.23 came out, except for the new champ of course.

I honestly agree, the game changed way too much with the preseason and you can actually just tell from the queue lengths that a LOT of people stopped playing temporarily or even permanently because of the massive changes...

Nothing that has been introduced this pre-season has been an improvement over last season - the tank meta was by far the most fun and engaging state of LoL. ADCs scaled into late-game, tanks and bruisers could function as a frontline while assassins could still take out squishy priority targets and we probably saw the largest selection of mid-laners EVER during that time. The mage and tank roles have now been completely invalidated - seeing a 5k health Volibear melt within _seconds_ of engaging an ADC is retarded. Certain masteries were easily predicted as being overpowered due to their interaction with certain champions but feedback was ignored. Certain items were so obviously overpowered (ER, GRB) in testing and - again - feedback was ignored. Towers are more irrelevant than ever in combat, but still provide tons of gold. Snowballing mechanics were removed in Season 3 because they didn't promote skillful play, but rather permit the winners to get even more ahead when winning, and punish losers for - well - losing. Now they're being reintroduced with a vengeance and the outcome is predictable you wonder how people paid to work on this game as their job can motivate their decision.

Riot managed to make a larger selection of ADCs viable only because they're completely overpowered compared to every other class in the game._ This is not good game design. _ It's a fucking circus.

Bronze/ranked should only be available to players that have shown a willingness to participate in matches they played in in Normals.

I can't stress this enough; the problem with the game right now (apart from Yasuo and Mordekaiser) is trolls. If you get a troll on your team, you start the game 4v5, and it's over essentially at the 4-minute mark. I've reported the same people in my little play-group 25 times for not participation and throwing, and they have never ever been restricted out of ranked, and ofc not banned at all. 

Riot doesn't give a flying fuck about trolls, and game experience; their useless piece of shit psychologists (who themselves only want to continue receiving funds) have done nothing but foster the notion that "reform" and 4th and 5th chances are not only _ok_, but should be how things are done. Kaceytron does nothing but troll, has probably trolled in 6-7,000 games, all of them streamed, and Riot is completely ok with Kacey doing this to all of her teammates.

If Kacey has learned that streaming + biggest troll on the planet doesn't warrant a ban, what do you think obscure non-streamers have figured out/are doing?

Until Riot gets their head out of their ass, and rescind bad players' ability to join ranked, any issue or problem will exacerbated by trolls. 4v5 games are over before they start.
